text: Hi, does anyone know a way to bypass rules on properties through the API? Specifically the restriction on future dates only. For the purposes of cloning. Thanks

Hi everyone,

I have a question regarding HubSpot’s API capabilities. Does HubSpot provide a server-side API for handling calls, or is it limited to the JavaScript front-end only? I’m looking to avoid creating my own interface for managing calls and writing synchronization with the telephony provider.

Thanks in advance for your help!
OBJECT_NOT_FOUND
it doesn't error just returns no results

Hey everyone, quick question regarding the HubSpots Custom Object API.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/objects/custom-objects#delete-a-custom-object|In the documentation>, it shows how to delete an entire custom object, but if I’m looking to delete only a property within a custom object, is it as simple as running a `DELETE` request pointing to `<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/properties/{objectID}/{property}>`?
I noticed this on the new docs, are all legacy APIs being sunsetted? or just lists <@UQNEXHW14>
lists and lists alone for this
gracias
de nada

looking for a "best practice" approach for upgrading my existing app.  I'd like to start using the optional scopes to detect whether a client has capabilities for our app to create/update custom objects.  My existing app does not request those scopes.  I know how I can add new optional scopes - but any suggestions for how to go forward: create a new app, r add the optional scopes to the existing app?

At the moment - I don't have a *business* case for why I would want to treat these as different apps.  Though that might be a possibility.  For now, its a question of compatibility between existing installs and new installs with new scopes.
If I add the scopes to my app, that doesn't change anything for existing installs, right?  But if I have an existing user who wants new behavior - they'd have to go through the authentication again?
If that's the case - it seems the easiest approach is to add new (optional) scopes to my existing app.  Right?
looks like you worked this out yourself :laughing:
you got it!  that or use the batch archive endpoint if you have multiple
:slightly_smiling_face: Is that the right solution?

yeah.  that seems correct.  you can add the scopes now and all new accounts will need to approve them.  any installs will need to reauth to confirm that t hey have appropriate access to what you want granted
Thanks!
no prob!  good luck out there!

Hi All, I am connect to the endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/emails/> I have been told that with this end point I can create a new Marketing Email.  Which I can, but I don't see anywhere in the documentation where to send the body of the email. From what I can tell this endpoint only allows you to create a new Marketing email and once it is created the user has to open the email in HubSpot and input the email body.

What I am trying to do is send in the email body from an internally developed application that creates newsletters.  We want to use HubSpot as the sending mechanism.  Making the user copy and paste the message body is not optimal.
It also seems that the end point also ignores the templatePath parameter completely.
:wave: Hola, equipo.
Hay alguien por ahí, necesito ayuda...
